Finally, given that sex-reversal effects have now been detected in both turtles and lizards
14, 27 , further research is urgently needed to test the hypothesis that the responses we document here are taxonomically widespread, which is partially supported by the consistent responses reported across various TSD turtles to simpler thermal oscillations
16â€“ 18, 48 . Furthermore, studies that incorporate natural nest thermal oscillations under realistic climate change scenarios across varied taxa would help illuminate the mysteries of TSD and the future of the many reptiles that rely on this environmental mechanism of sex determination.
